rural_development_schemes.scheme_name: Scheme for Grant of Additional Scholarship to the Students of Other Backward Classes of Andaman and Nicobar Islands, for Pursuing Higher Studies Anywhere in India after Secondary Level (Except Class XI & XII)
objectives: Provide additional financial assistance (scholarship) to OBC students of non-creamy layer for pursuing higher education after Secondary (X)/Senior Secondary (XII)
Supplement the cost of education in Government-recognized Polytechnic/ITI/College/University anywhere in India

benefits.scholarship_value: ₹1000 per month for 10 months in an academic session
disbursement: Directly credited to Aadhaar-linked bank account
Admissible only to students who passed the previous academic session
Dependent on fund availability in a financial year

eligibility_criteria: Belong to non-creamy layer of OBC as per Notification dated 16th December 2005 and amendments
Domicile of Andaman and Nicobar Islands
Passed Secondary (Class X) or Senior Secondary (Class XII) from a recognized Board
Pursuing higher education in a recognized Institution/University
Limited to two children of the same parent/guardian (except in case of multiple births in second live birth)

Eligible courses include: Degree (Graduation/Post-Graduation), M.Phil, Ph.D., Post-Doctoral Programmes, Post-Graduate Diploma in Management/Medicine, Commercial Pilot License, CA/ICWA/CS/ICFA, Pharmacy, Nursing, LLB, BFS, Para-medical, Mass Communication, Hotel Management, etc.
Post Matriculation non-degree courses like ITI, 3-year Diploma in Polytechnic
Students pursuing Post-graduate courses in Medicine must not practice during the course
Scholarship awarded on a year-to-year basis, subject to passing the stage/year/semesters
Scholarship stopped if student fails a class for more than one year
Scholarship cancelled and recoverable if obtained by false statements
Scholarship refundable if studies are discontinued
exclusions: Students repeating the same stage/level of education in a different subject/stream (e.g., B.Sc. after B.A, M.A. in another subject)
Students pursuing another professional course after completing one (e.g., LLB after B.T/B.Ed)

Courses funded by Central/State Government or UT Administration (e.g., Aircraft Maintenance Engineering, Private Pilot Licence, Defence Academies, Pre-Examination Training Centre, distance education courses)
renewal: Renewed yearly if scholar secures promotion to the next higher class
Renewable for next academic year with medical certificate or sufficient proof for inability to appear in annual examination
Eligible for scholarship in promoted class per University/Institution regulations

steps: Register on NSP Portal (https://scholarships.gov.in/) using 'New Registration' icon
Receive Student Registration ID after successful registration
Login using 'Fresh Application' icon with Student Registration ID
Fill and submit the application form via 'Application Form' icon
Receive system-generated registration number for future reference
Applications invited in May-June via advertisement in leading newspapers and other media

documents_required: Certificates of Class X/XII, Diploma/Degree of qualifying examination
Caste Certificate signed by Revenue Officer (not below Tehsildar)
Non-creamy Layer Certificate signed by Revenue Officer (not below Tehsildar)
Receipt of acknowledgment of scholarship from previous year (for renewal)
Copy of marks statement counter-signed by Head of Institution (for renewal)
